climbs.name: My Favorite Things (aka Blue Grass)
climbs.fa: (TR) Randy Vogel & Alan Roberts, 1978, FL: Jonny Woodward, Darrel Hensel & Rob Raker, September 1986

content.description:
Start up a short slab to reach a prominent ceiling with positive holds which is turned with creative body positioning - the solitary bolt is rusted and in need of replacement. Once established on the slab above the roof continue along the path of least resisitance (up and right) to reach the prominent hand/fist crack above which is followed to the top.

Descend by rapping (80') off bolts atop

Black and Blue

, the next route to the right.

Three stars out of five.
content.location: Just right of center - look for an obvious slanting crack which starts partway up the face.

content.description: Start up the slightly grainy slot to the first bolt.  Stem or grovel ( just a bit ) through the corner to the arete.  A bit airy for a 5.7, work your way up through the next 5 bolts to the two bolts anchor with fancy integrated steel 'biners.  A really fun 5.7 somewhat isolated from other routes at the grade.
content.location: The route is located on the far right side of the face.  Climb out of the cave through 6 bolts to a two bolt anchor with integrated carabiners.  You could continue to another set of bolts higher up, but they have a single quick link each and make for a bad pull after a rappel.

climbs.name: Flustered
climbs.fa: Dave Haber, Sheryl Haber & Alan Bartlett, May 1992

content.description: Jam or lieback the inital crack then punch it up the face above past two bolts along a seam. Interesting climbing on fun features. Two stars out of five.
content.location: Left of center and just left of a prominent right-facing corner to roof.

climbs.name: Blue Ribbon
climbs.fa: Jonny Woodward, Darrel Hensel & Rob Raker, September 1986

content.description: Easy slab leads into a discontinous thin crack system which dies out below the top and face climbing leads to the top. Runout on easier terrain but the pro is adequate at the crux. Two stars out of five.
content.protection:
Gear to 2 inches

Rappel (80') from anchors atop

Black and Blue

just to the left.
content.location:
Right edge of the face and just right of

Black and Blue

.

climbs.name: Black and Blue
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Tommy Romero, December 1996

content.description:
Bob struck gold with yet another oxymoronic Joshua Tree sport climbing classic.

After a short section of easy slab pass a horizontal and commit to the steeper more continuous face above where you will encounter very balancy and sequential moves with some trickery thrown in as well.

Difficult for the grade and a tough onsight. Easily four stars out of five.
content.protection:
7 bolts, 2 bolt anchor/rap (80')  (all bolts 3/8")

optional 2.5" cam
content.location:
Right side of the face between

My Favorite Things (aka Blue Grass)

and

Blue Ribbon

and just right of parallel black streaks up high.
